snippet: A South African judge ordered prosecutors to investigate whether the government of Zimbabwe had committed human rights abuses, saying it would benefit Zimbabweans and South Africans.
abstract: South African judge, Hans Fabricius, orders prosecutors to investigate whether the government of Zimbabwe had committed human rights abuses; ruling is the first to make use of 2002 statute spelling out South Africa's international law obligations.
lead_paragraph: A South African judge ordered prosecutors to investigate whether the government of Zimbabwe had committed human rights abuses, saying it would benefit Zimbabweans and South Africans.

headline.main: South Africa: Court Orders Investigation Into Allegations of Torture in Zimbabwe
headline.print_headline: South Africa: Court Orders Investigation Into Allegations of Torture in Zimbabwe

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
